channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Shelley Duvall, Star of ‘The Shining’ and ‘Nashville,’ Dies at 75
item.description: Her lithesome features and quirky screen presence made her a popular figure in 1970s movies, particularly Robert Altman’s.

item.title: After France’s Election, the Far Right Is at a Crossroads
item.description: The National Rally’s campaign was marred by controversies that undercut its effort to convince voters that it was ready for power. Now, leaders are asking where the party goes from here.

item.title: More than 1 in 3 Americans have a side hustle, but they’re spending that extra cash right away. Financial experts say that’s the wrong approach.
item.description: Time is the ultimate luxury. Why are young people spending it driving for Uber if that doesn’t even get them ahead financially?

item.title: Trump’s Trials and The Republican Convention
item.description: As Donald Trump heads to the Republican convention, his criminal cases look a lot less threatening.

item.title: Students Protest Job Quotas in Bangladesh’s Streets
item.description: University students oppose the reinstatement of a quota system for government jobs that was abolished in 2018.

item.title: The U.S. just got its best inflation report in over 3 years, but stocks are still down. Here’s why
item.description: “Is the market down? Or is this the most extreme rotation that we've ever seen out of everything that people have been hiding in?” Bancreek Capital Advisors’s Eric Pachman asked.

item.title: Biden Campaign Has Long Fed Softball Questions to Friendly Interviewers
item.description: A review of President Biden’s interviews shows he is often asked the same few questions in interviews. It’s not a coincidence.

item.title: Many in Gaza City Ignore Israel’s Calls to Leave
item.description: Israel’s military dropped leaflets laying out four “safe corridors” for them to use to flee south, but few appeared to be heeding the warning on Thursday.

item.title: Forget big tech stocks, the ‘Other 493’ are set for a comeback says BofA
item.description: "Growth is broadening out and so should the market."

item.title: U.S. Uncovers Russian Plot to Assassinate C.E.O. of German Arms Maker
item.description: The company produces artillery shells and tanks that Ukraine has used in its war against Russia.

item.title: Israeli Military Clears General Who Approved Fire on House With Hostages on Oct. 7
item.description: The military conceded that it had “failed in its mission” to protect an Israeli village from attack, but exonerated a general who oversaw the fighting there.

item.title: Magic Johnson tells young athletes the secret to staying ahead: Get a manager
item.description: Sports pros have a short window to build wealth and without proper help, they can go broke fast

item.title: Some Biden Advisers Are Discussing How to Convince Him to Step Aside
item.description: Close allies of the president are developing a case for why he should end his re-election campaign, though it is not clear that the discussions have reached him.

item.title: Kenyan President Fires His Cabinet After Nationwide Protests
item.description: President William Ruto dismissed all but one of his cabinet secretaries after demonstrations over a finance bill that would have raised taxes led to the deaths of at least 41 people.

item.title: Why the new Olympic gymnastics leotards are $3k each—and have a record number of crystals
item.description: During the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, U.S. gymnasts will wear custom garments adorned with up to 10,000 Swarovski crystals.
